title: Fool-proof, tight conditions for prisoners’ release in future
byline: Following malpractices involved in the release of prisoners, the Justice Ministry will introduce fool-proof, tight conditions for remission of jail terms of those behind bars in view of national events such as Independence Day, Vesak and Christmas, a Minister said.

title: Irregularities mar elephant census results
byline: Despite the lapse of nearly one year, the results of the elephant census are yet to be determined due to complaints about irregularities in the process.

title: No further operational halts at East Container Terminal - SLPA
byline: The Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA) yesterday moved to reassure the shipping industry an end to operational shutdowns at the East Container Terminal (ECT) previously required for construction.

title: June tourist arrivals surge, but monthly target faces steep climb
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism sector witnessed a robust start to June, with arrivals in the first five days surging by 35.92 percent year-on-year to 21,293.

title: Sri Lanka on Fire
byline: Sri Lanka produced a splendid performance to beat Chinese Taipei 3-1 in their AFC Asian Cup Qualifier (Saudi Arabia 2027) at the Racecourse Grounds in Colombo.

title: Missing elephant ‘Sumedha’ spotted at Minneriya National Park
byline: ‘Sumedha’, the elephant that went missing after a road accident in Galapitagala, Maradankadawala on March 7, has been spotted in the Minneriya National Park, officials confirmed.

title: PUCSL to reveal revised electricity tariffs today
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) said that the revised electricity tariffs for the second half of 2025 will be released today (June 11).

title: Austrians hold vigil to mourn 10 victims of school shooting
byline: Thousands of people in Austria have held a candlelight vigil for the victims of a school shooting in which 10 people were killed.

title: Sinkhole disrupts train services on upcountry railway line
byline: Train services along the Upcountry Railway Line have been disrupted following the sudden appearance of a sinkhole between Peradeniya and Kandy, the Department of Railways confirmed today.

title: Budget airline Jetstar Asia to close in weeks, customers offered refunds
byline: Singapore-based budget airline Jetstar Asia will close down at the end of July, with more than 500 employees laid-off.

title: Curfew announced in Los Angeles
byline: Mayor Karen Bass of Los Angeles announced at a news conference on Tuesday evening that the city will begin imposing a curfew in downtown Los Angeles as part of its strategy to quell protests that were entering a fifth night.

title: Sri Lankan wins big at Manhunt International
byline: Sri Lanka’s Piyumal Sithum Pattuwearachchi was named First Runner-Up at the 23rd edition of Manhunt International, held today in Bangkok, Thailand.

title: Vital surgeries at National Hospital Colombo at risk of halt due to dilapidated condition
byline: Persistent water leaks have plagued the Accident Service theatre complexes at the National Hospital Colombo for more than a month, yet no repairs have been undertaken, according to hospital sources.

title: 78-year rabies eradication drive becomes a ‘beggar’s wound’: AWC says
byline: The Animal Welfare Coalition (AWC) strongly criticised successive Health Ministries for what it describes as a “veritable beggar’s wound” in the guise of a rabies eradication programme, sustained for over 78 years without achieving meaningful results.

title: Controversial clearing of 323 containers sparks delays at Colombo Port: Opposition MP
byline: The decision by Customs officers to subject all containers to stringent inspections following the controversial clearing of 323 containers has led to significant delays at the Colombo Port, Opposition MP Dayasiri Jayasekera said.

title: Ranil begins dialogue with TPA
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) ally Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) met former President Ranil Wickremeisnghe at his Flower Road office yesterday to discuss several political issues.

title: Electricity tariffs increased by 15%
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has announced a 15 percent increase in electricity tariffs, effective from June 12, 2025.

title: Prisons Chief to get half salary during suspension
byline: The Cabinet has approved the payment of 50% of the salary of Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya, who is currently under remand custody, for the duration of his suspension.

title: Cabinet approves amendments to ban physical punishments
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to amend key legislation to ban physical punishments causing physical injuries across all sectors in Sri Lanka.

title: Cabinet approves new consultancy contract for BIA master plan
byline: The government has approved the selection of a new consultancy firm to prepare the master plan for Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), following the cancellation of a previous contract due to procedural non-compliance.

title: NPP’s nominee elected mayor of Bandarawela Municipal Council
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) member Sagaradheera Vishva Vikrama was elected as the Mayor of the Bandarawela Municipal Council today securing eight votes in the council election.

title: Batticaloa mayor elected as ITAK secures council with SJB backing
byline: Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) has taken control of the Batticaloa Municipal Council, with Sivam Pakkiyanathan elected as Mayor today in a vote backed by Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) councillors.

title: Sri Lanka Police deploy 24/7 security at Chabad houses
byline: Police said today that any threats to the safety of foreign nationals on the island will be evaluated, and appropriate security measures will be implemented accordingly.

title: Committee report on fatal Kotmale bus accident handed over to Minister
byline: The report of the committee appointed to investigate into the fatal road accident in the Garadiella area of the Kotmale Police Division on May 11, was officially handed over today.

title: Whiskey, cigarettes worth over Rs. 25 Mn seized by Customs at UPB warehouse
byline: The Sri Lanka Customs today seized 1,612 cartons of cigarettes and 10 one litfe bottles of whisky concealed inside 26 packages declared as household furniture and personal goods at the Ceylon Shipping Lines UPB warehouse in Dematagoda.

title: Upcountry train services limited to Peradeniya until further notice
byline: Train services on the Upcountry Line have been limited to Peradeniya Railway Station until further notice due to the sudden appearance of a sinkhole between Peradeniya and Kandy, the Railways Department said.

title: Maid at Keheliya residence arrested
byline: A maid working at the residence of former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Ranil Wickremesinghe leaves CID
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago.

title: Elon Musk says he now ’regrets’ some of his posts about Trump
byline: Billionaire businessman Elon Musk said on Wednesday he regretted some of the posts he made last week about U.S. President Donald Trump as they had gone ’’too far’’.

title: Kaduwela Mayor claims fall at event part of conspiracy against NPP
byline: Kaduwela Mayor Ranjan Jayalal has alleged that his recent fall at a public event was not accidental but part of a conspiracy targeting the National People’s Power (NPP).

title: Thushara Upuldeniya further remanded
byline: Thushara Upuldeniya, the Commissioner General of Prisons, was ordered to be further remanded till June 25 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Thanuja Lakmali.

title: Ranil arrives at CID
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago.

title: Court blocks SJB women’s nominations in Galnewa Pradeshiya Sabha
byline: The Court of Appeal today issued an interim order staying the Commissioner General of Election from naming the women members for the seats obtained by the Samagi Jana Balawagaya (SJB) on the basis of proportional representation at the Galnewa Pradeshiya

title: President Dissanayake arrives in Germany
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake who departed the country for an official visit to Germany, arrived this morning (11) at Berlin Brandenburg International Airport.

title: Couple loses Rs 4.79 crore with digital arrest, scamster visits Sri Lankan casino
byline: A retired engineer and his wife in Bengaluru lost Rs 4.79 crore to cyber fraudsters, who placed them under ’’digital arrest’’ over their alleged involvement in a money laundering case and non-payment of credit card bills.

title: Anuradhapura Prison Superintendent further remanded
byline: The Anuradhapura Magistrate’s Court today ordered the further remand of the Superintendent of Anuradhapura Prison, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with the unlawful release of an inmate under the presidential pardon granted for Vesak Poya.

title: Sri Lanka and Australia to strengthen police cooperation against transnational crime
byline: Sri Lanka and Australia are set to enhance their law enforcement partnership through a new Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the Australian Federal Police and the Sri Lanka Police, aimed at combating international crime and strengthening police cooperation.

title: PUCSL approves 15% electricity tariff increase, Effective from tomorrow
byline: Following a comprehensive review and public consultations on a proposed 18.3% electricity tariff hike by the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB), the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has decided to limit the increase to 15%. The revised tariffs will come into effect from tomorrow, June 12.
